Name: Dust 1947: Luftwaffe Fallschirmjäger Battle Squad
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Death from the skies over Babylon! The Fallschirmjäger Battle Squad deals with any light or heavy enemy infantry the Luftwaffe ground forces might encounter. Thanks to their Fliegerfaust (Rocket Launchers), they are not helpless against aircraft and can blow one to pieces in seconds. Their Maschinengewehr 48 (Machinegun) is efficient against these as well.

Name: Dust 1947: Panzerkamplaufer I-L – "Luft Horst"
Description:
Description from the publisher:

This airborne operations ready walker is used in the Luftwaffe Ground Divisions. Thanks to its thrusters, it can be parachuted directly on the battlefield, joining the action as soon as the rest of the invasion force arrives. This walker is tasked with providing long range fire support thanks to its Nebelwerfer Rocket Launchers. They can obliterate whole areas of the battlefield in seconds. It is also capable of delivering smoke shells that are very effective in disrupting enemy's fire, protecting the Luftwaffe forces. It is presented here in its Cerberus Camo Pattern, as used in Europe circa 1947.

Name: Dust 1947: Panzerkamplaufer I-G (Laser) – Luft Hermann
Description:
Description from the publisher:

This airborne operations ready walker is used in the Luftwaffe Ground Divisions. Thanks to its thrusters, it can be parachuted directly on the battlefield, joining the action as soon as the rest of the invasion force arrives. This model is tasked with destroying enemy tanks and walkers with the help of its powerful long range laser guns. It is presented here in its Cerberus Camo Pattern, as used in Europe circa 1947.

Name: Going Places in Africa and South America
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Explore Africa and South America!

Visit 76 cities in 52 countries and explore 8 points of interest across the continents.

Each player receives one Destination card to determine their starting position, or hometown. Another 12 Destination cards are then dealt to each player. The goal is to plan a round trip from your hometown via the 12 destinations. The first person to complete a round trip wins!

To aid the traveler, train stations, airports and harbors are available as a quick travel option if a player has a corresponding Compass card. The Compass cards can help or stall your trip in a number of ways, including changing the outcome of the game. A comfortable lead can change into a frenzied contest!

Designed for 2-4 players and takes you on a different path around the continents each round!

Name: Going Places in Asia and Oceania
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Traverse the vast continents of Asia and Oceania!

Travel down the ancient Silk Road and visit the many cities in Asia and Oceania.

Each player receives one Destination card to determine their starting position, or hometown. Another 15 Destination cards are then dealt to each player. The goal is to plan a round trip from your hometown via the 15 destinations. The first person to complete a round trip wins!

To aid the traveler, airports and harbors are available as a quick travel option if a player has a corresponding Compass card. The Compass cards can help or stall your trip in a number of ways, including changing the outcome of the game. A comfortable lead can change into a frenzied contest!

Designed for 2-4 players and takes you on a different path around the continents each round!

Name: Colour Blind
Description:
In Colour Blind, players act as apprentices to the art greats, but disaster has struck and they must reorganize the spilt paint before their masters come back. Players place cards in the center of the playing area, and when a player can recognize a valid order of paint on the table, they hit the timer. The goal of the game is then to build a set of paints in order from what is on the table before the timer runs out. If they do, they win a point.

A battery-powered timer is included in the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Perdition's Mouth: Abyssal Rift – Soul Spire
Description:
Soul Spire, the first major expansion to Perdition's Mouth: Abyssal Rift, brings new strategies, tactics, elements and such, most of which fans have asked for at one time or another. The expansion includes a newly designed map system, based on tile-able maps, three new factions, at least six new heroes, and a completely new scenario system.

Continuing on from the story in Perdition's Mouth, Soul Spire moves us to an entirely new location with its own rules and problems. Soul Spire comes with three different playable factions that the players can ally with, each having their own story path that describes the events based on your progress.

Scenario 1 introduces the players to new mechanics before branching off down the path of your chosen faction. Your decisions affect how the game progresses and how much more difficult future objectives become, where even victory in a scenario for your faction can ultimately lead to another faction winning the game overall. Each faction has a mini-campaign over at least 3 scenarios, which combined with multiple hero options gives some serious replayability to a more tactical, strategic dungeon crawler.

Expands on the rules first introduced in Perdition’s Mouth bringing some entirely new ideas to the dungeon crawler style game.

Name: Sword & Sorcery: Hero Pack – Samyria the Druid/Shaman
Description:
The world of Sword & Sorcery always needs new heroes! With this Hero Pack, you now have the possibility to introduce a new, powerful character into your campaign.

In times of dire need, unusual individuals stand up and fight against the forces of Darkness... and here comes Samyria, daughter of the Earth, bear-friend and skin-changer. Samyria can be played as either a Druid or Shaman.

As a Druid, Samyria is able to control the forces of nature, summoning grasping roots from the ground
and ultimately changing her body into a gigantic Grizzly!

As a Shaman, Samyria calls and interacts with all the spirits of Otherworld. She can control the battlefield by creating soul totems and commanding Bjorn, her valuable Grizzly companion!

This Hero Pack features two miniatures of Samyria (normal and Ghost Soul form), one Bear figure, her Soul Gem, and new cards - including legendary treasures such as the Dream Catcher artifact and the powerful Force of Nature weapon.

Name: Sword & Sorcery: Onamor and Volkor
Description:
A Kickstarter bonus hero that was available for individual purchase at Gen Con 2017.  Includes miniatures for Onamor, the Necromancer/Summoner hero & his companions Nightwalker and Efreet, as well as a miniature for Volkor, the Dragonheart/Dragonflame Hero.  Also includes character sheets & cards.

—user summary

Name: Uvaldeopoly
Description: Themed version of Monopoly based on Uvalde, Tx.

Name: Himmel und Hölle
Description:
The players have to get their 4 pawns into the blue center space (heaven). Movement is dertermined by a die. The 5th pawn is called "hellhound" and is placed on the big ringed space of it's own color to guard the neighbouring hell of the same color.
Enemy pawns may be captured while moving on the outher ring of the game board and are placed on the hell-space of the active player. The hell-spaces are ringed by 7 smaler spaces of the same color. These are called hell-yards. pawns caught in hell may be rescued by another pawn, that enters hell through the hell-yards. It's the hellhounds task to prevent this.
Pawns that are caught while moving on the inner ring aren't sent to hell but have to start from the beginning.

Name: Miss Bernard is a Wild Card: My Weird School – The Game
Description:
In My Weird School, players collect cards to build a crazy five-card sentence on their boards where the first two words rhyme.  After three rounds, the player with the most points wins.

—user summary

Welcome to Ella Mentry School, the weirdest elementary school in the history of the world. Things just got even weirder with the arrival of Miss Bernard, a new teacher encouraging kids to say whatever they want... about the other teachers! And that is just what you’ll do in this sentence-building game that proves school can be serious fun and certifiably weird!

—description from the publisher

Name: Orphans & Ashes: More Phun
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Burning orphanages just got More Phun now that more characters have joined the fray! Play as Benny, the least noble healer money can buy as she tries to profit from this tragedy, and Sooba, whose speed is only matched by her bloodlust.

In addition to new characters, the Orphans & Ashes: More Phun expansion adds two new players and three new ways to play:

     Head to Head puts up to four players against each other in a flaming free for all! 
     Splitting the Party lets players pair up in teams of two with competing goals. 
     Not Alone! turns the game of strategic orphan burning into a cooperative game of saving orphans and being heroes or something.

Name: Arcadia Quest: Pets – Chuck
Description:
Level 1
Armor: 0
Health: 2
Ability: May store up to 3 unused non-CRIT rolled by close owners (lost if Chuck dies). Close Owners may move these stored results to their rolls.

Promotional figure offered by The Dice Tower

Name: Arcadia Quest: Princess Pearl
Description:
Defense: 2
Health: 3
Ability: Exhaust hero to un-exhaust a hero in line of sight.

Promotional figure first offered at GenCon 2017 from CMON.

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Pirates!
Description:
Our heroic party of adventurers pledged wand and sword to defend the good people from the vile villains in Battle for Greyport. Now, to their chagrin, new threats approach the city from the high seas. With its crimson sails, a new party of adventurers sets out aboard the Crimson Drake to meet these evildoers head on in Battle for Greyport – Pirates!

This expansion to the 2016 cooperative deck-building game The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport expands the game with four new player heroes and starting decks, one for each of the dashing privateers from The Red Dragon Inn 4. The expansion also includes new monsters, mechanisms, recruits, and scenarios!

Now 2-5 players can team up and fight off these dastardly pirate captains and their host of salty sea dogs. Can you sink their ships and save the day?

Includes 2 Drink cards for The Red Dragon Inn: Crew Brew and First Mate's Lime Juice.

Name: Dust 1947: PT-47A "Plavayushchiy" Tank-47
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Developed initially for special operations use, this command amphibious ready vehicle is slowly becoming a staple of SSU forces around the planet. At the moment it can be mostly found with Spetsnaz and PLA forces, which make the most of its capabilities: the PT-47A can go nearly everywhere with a small group of soldiers. This version is equipped with enhance communications capabilities perfectly suited for a command vehicle.

Name: Dust 1947: Steel Guards Anti-Infantry squad
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Steel Guards are some of the most formidable fighters on the planet. Their half-robotic bodies makes them very hard to kill, allowing them to gain incredible combat experience. The Anti-Infantry squad of the Steel Guard is one of the most feared combat unit on the planet. Nobody ever faced them that wasn't changed by the experience. The thermobaric grenade they fire melts flesh, bone and steel alike. Nothing known to man can survive the explosion.

Name: City
Description:
The game is 120 cards depicting buildings, people, cars, trains, airport, river, and other city sites.

"The [12] cards with the river are removed from the game [deck] and placed one against another, to form the right-hand edge.  The remaining cards are shuffled and each player is dealt 15 cards. Each player places his cards in front of himself openly. The rest of the cards are placed face down in a deck [draw pile] in the middle of the table.

The player on the left of the one who deals [the dealer] starts the game. The opening player places matching cards to the river cards already lying on the table. If he cannot join a card, he takes one from the covered deck [draw pile] and his left-hand neighbor continues. Each player may join all the matching cards he has [during his turn]. Cards can also be put in between the cards already lying on the table, if they match the others on both sides.

The left side has no limit, so with each game a new colorful city can be built.

The winner is the player who finishes first with his cards. He [or she] is the "greater builder". You cannot always join all the cards. If at the end of the game there are still some cards left, the player with the fewest cards left wins."

The game was co-published by "Spil og Lær", Danish for "Play and Learn".

Name: The 7th Continent: BGG Promo Cards
Description:
Five new cards to enhance your experience with The 7th Continent, mostly providing alternative versions of existing cards, for even more replayability.

Cards included are:
054 - H1351
097 - H1352
350 - H1353
586 - H1354
666 - H1355

Name: T2029: The Official Terminator 2 Board Game
Description:
T2029 is an intense cooperative game where players must coordinate the efforts of Resistance to defeat Skynet in the future to send back a protector for John Connor in the past. The game will play in approximately 90 minutes and will explore the future world glimpsed in Terminator 2: Judgement Day, revealing the final days in the war against the Machines.

Players take the roles of commanders in John Connor’s Resistance during the last days of the war against Skynet in 2029. Tasked with holding back the machines long enough for John Connor’s assault team to reach Skynet’s Central Command, players must manage the conflict on multiple fronts. Combat, sabotage and gaining access to Skynet’s Defence Grid all play a part in achieving success. But in order to save the future, you must also save the past by reprogramming a T-800 Terminator to protect John against the advanced T-1000 in 1995.

—description from the publisher

Name: Surge: Battle for the Oleshky Sands
Description:
There is an unprecedented military build-up as a new front emerges in the Balkan States, with both the NATO and Russian superpowers vying for control. Forces are mobilizing in the region at an alarming rate with the UN summit deadline looming. There are skirmishes every day in different territories as both sides struggle for control. You have been tasked with securing the new front, and it's critical that you do this before the UN sanctioned ceasefire comes into effect stopping any further build-up. Under your command is a full complement of military assets that are battle ready. The terrain is a challenge, ranging from the desert like Oleshky Sands to the Codrii forests and beyond to the Balkan Mountains.

Surge: Battle for the Oleshky Sands is a two-player game of confrontation. Your mission is to deploy the assets as quickly as possible to neutralize the enemy and secure control of the region. To retain control of an area, you must have the most units in that area, and to control the region, you must control the most number of areas. There is a constant struggle to retain control of the different regions with battle lines moving quickly. No two games will ever play the same.

Name: Crop Circles
Description: Crop Circles is a family card game of manipulation and bluffing. Players attempt to either collect a set of alien crop circles or attempt to manipulate the board to align them to win.

Name: 51st State: Arena Promo
Description: Number 11 out of 25 expansions contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017

Name: Dust 1947: MI 48-H "Invader"
Description: The Spetsnaz fulfill the most dangerous missions in the name of the Sino-Soviet Union. And as such deserve the best equipment available! The Invader is the latest development of a long line of very efficient helicopter family that has been of great service to the Motherland. The SSU uses by far the largest number of helicopter, to transport troops, destroy vehicles and even other aircraft. The Invader combines the best of two functions: it transports a small group of Spetsnaz into battle and then stays on target to provide fire support.

Name: Dust 1947: Chinese Army Starter Set – "Battlegroup PLA"
Description:
The People's Liberation Army (PLA) comes from the Far East to help the tide of the Red Revolution cover the world! These fierce fighters are lead in battle by siblings who have developed a unique fighting style, who is gaining tremendous popularity in the Motherland. Expanding far from the South-Asia region, PLA forces can now be found all over the world, wherever the SSU fights. This new force will surely shake up the war and lead the Bloc to victory.

The PLA Battlegroup contains the following units:
- The Dragon (SU501)
- The Phoenix (SU502)
- PLA Assault Squad (SU531)
- Nina (TSH) (SU532)
Everything you need to start a new glorious PLA Faction Army is included in this Battlegroup! Please note that the Dust 1947 Starter rules, a durable neoprene gaming mat, terrain, dice, etc. are included in this Starter Set.

Name: Stickman
Description: Stickman is a party game that involves drawing stickmen on players' back. To win, feel the drawings well and spot them among multiple cards. Bluffing is involved, and a second rules variant is played like a telephone game in teams.

Name: Dokmus: Return of Erefel
Description: Dokmus: Return of Erefel adds new game boards to the Dokmus base game, brings seasons to the island, and introduces Erefel, a new guardian.

Name: Dust 1947: Operation Kondor
Description:
Death from the skies! Operation Kondor, the aftermath of Operation Babylon has started! After the initial Axis invasion, things are getting heated in a hurry between the Tigris and the Euphrates. The Allies and SSU have now realized that the third Bloc wouldn't have committed so many forces for anything other than a prime objective. If the Axis sought oil, they would have attacked elsewhere like the Arabian Peninsula or Iran's oil fields. They sure are in for more than sand and old ruins, aren't they? NDAK forces have finally found their target: an isolated outpost on the outskirts of the desert held by a handful of French Foreign Legionnaires in an area crawling with Spetsnaz. Only the Luftwaffe boys can mount the fastest strike ever to take this objective before anyone else: Operation Kondor.

This new expansion for Dust 1947 describes all the Luftwaffe forces, with new characters, vehicles, Platoons, etc. With the Operation itself come three short stories by Andy Chambers himself, a must read for every Dust fan!

Name: Twilight of the Sun-King: Scenario Book 1 – Louis XIV at War
Description:
From the Introduction:

"This booklet contains scenarios for use with the Twilight of the Sun King rules and it focuses on the two major conflicts of the era in Western and Central Europe. The first of this is the war of 1688 to 1697, which has various names, the Nine Years War, the War of the Grand Alliance, or the League of Augsburg. The War of the Spanish Succession, 1701 to 1714, was the second major conflict where France and its allies faced a coalition headed by Holland, Britain, Austria, and their allies."
Families: History: War of the Spanish Succession

Name: Lost Vegas
Description:
There are many things buried in the sands of the new Old West, just waiting to be discovered and claimed. But the sandstorms are coming; they always come. They have long since swallowed the city, and no matter how much you uncover, they will continue their malicious barrage. They strike fast and without warning, unless you have the right equipment.

As prospectors in Lost Vegas, you seek to dig up what the desert has reclaimed. You can move from location to location collecting money and valuable artifacts. Barricade your locations from the storms, or you'll find yourself having to uncover what you've already worked to find — or get ahead of the game and use your radar to see where the next storm is coming from. After the storms have passed, the prospector who has the most money and treasure (points) from the locations they occupy wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Lost World Lunch
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Lost World Lunch is a quick-play card game for 2-6 players. Each player takes on the role of a Dinosaur (the deck has three carnivores and three herbivores). Your goal as the Dinosaur is to get as many Victory Points as possible by Biting, Clawing, Stomping, and Smashing the pesky, trophy-seeking Victorian Hunters as they sip their tea and eat their lunch.

A game takes about 15-20 minutes to play. Each player is dealt three Hunters that they are racing against their opponents to complete. You complete a Hunter by matching (in order) all of the symbols on the Hunter’s card with your Attack cards, while trying to use the best Victory Point card on each Hunter.

Each Hunter is also looking to catch a specific Dinosaur (that upper left hand corner image of the Dinosaur on Sergei’s card). If a player completes a Hunter that was looking to catch them, they earn double points.

But watch out! There are special cards that allow your opponent to steal your Attack Cards or even swap your Hunter with theirs (getting all the associated Victory Points as well)!

Team Play and Simple Play (for young kids) As there are three Carnivores and three Herbivores in the deck, players can split into two teams and compete together, rather than playing a free-for-all. Also, if you ignore the VP and specials, you can use the game as a simple color/symbol matching game with younger children–work them up to Victory Points after they learn math skills and finally teach them the Special Rules when they have mastered Victory Points.

Name: New York Slice: Extra Cheese
Description:
Today's Special - +4 pts at the end of the game.

Given out at GenCon 2017

Name: A Column of Fire: New Advantage Tiles
Description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 2.

Components
6 Advantage Tiles

Preparation
The 6 new advantage tiles can either be shuffled in with all the existing advantage tiles, or 6 of the existing tiles can be removed from the ame and replaced with the 6 new tiles.  Tip: All of the advantage tiles that earn players victory points should remain in the game.

Play
As in the normal game, an advantage tile can only be used in a player's own turn. The two tiles with the torch symbol on them, which are used for the settlement of religious conflict, are exceptions to this: Players can use these tiles regardless of whether or not it is currently their turn.

Name: Alexandria: Board Game Shelf Promo
Description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 4

The Board Game Shelf replaces a random black-backed Furniture tile. When a Hero interest the Room containing the Board Game Shelf, if there are now at least two Heroes present, then all nearby Heroes lose time.

Components:
1 Board Game Shelf tile
1 English Rules tile
1 Rules Pamphlet (English & German)

Note: Rules pamphlet and rules tile contain identical information.

Name: Cacao: Diamante – New Huts
Description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for Day 16.

Adds 3 new huts.

May only be played with Cacao and both Chocolatl and Diamante.

SET-UP:

    The "New Huts" count as huts.
    They are placed as a supply near the bank together with the other huts as described in the "Cacao - Chocolatl" rules.
    Depending on the huts in play, you have to play with the Tree of Life, Favour of the Emperor or Gem Mines module from "Cacao - Diamante".
    The usual rules for playing with the huts module from "Cacao - Chocolatl" apply.

Name: Chimera Station: Interactive Modules Promo
Description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 7.

2 Interactive Tiles for the English Edition
2 Interactive Tiles for the Euro Edition

The 2 interactive tiles are Giant Billboard and Underground Clinic

Mix these interactive tiles into the supply for a slightly meaner game!

Name: Clank!: Wishing Wall
Description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 3.

Wishing Wall : device, cost 6
Choose two: Trash a card in your play area or discard pile/two fight/two move/one life

Name: Cottage Garden: The Easter Bunny
Description: One of 25 expansions contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017

Name: Flamme Rouge: Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 Promo
Description:
One of 25 expansions contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017.

Day 15

Name: Flick 'em Up!: Blacksmith
Description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 9.

Adds a Blacksmith building to any Flick 'em Up! scenario. Activating the Blacksmith gives players a free action of flicking a horseshoe. If the horseshoe hits a cowboy, then the next time that cowboy is knocked out and when the cowboy gets back on his feet, the player activating that cowboy must close his/her eyes before each action.

Components:
1 blacksmith workshop
2 feet
3 horseshoes
1 rules pamphlet (English & German)

Name: Mondrian
Description:
Piet Mondrian was one of the greatest modern painters, his abstract works influenced architecture and design as few artists have managed to do in history, players are invited to build works of art inspired by this undoubtedly one of the greatest plastic artists of all time.

In this game players need to create retangular areas with some tiles, the white areas make points to buy more tiles, and the colorful areas make victory points.

—description from the designer

Name: Gentes: New Cities
Description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for Day 5.

Contents:
1 action tile "new starting player"
8 bonus point tiles
4 hometown tiles
6 city tiles

Set Up
- The new starting player action tile replaces the corresponding action tile from the standard game.
- The new bonus point tiles are placed (sorted according to their kind) in four stacks next to the (old) bonus point tiles.  In two player games only one tile of each kind is used.
- A player takes all 10 city tokens (cities and hometowns) into his hands and lets them drop onto the table so that they are facing up with a random side.
- Beginning with the starting player and then progressing in clockwise order, the players place one of these tiles on one of the city squares of the game board until each of them has chosen 2 tiles.  Following certain placement rules.

New Starting Player Tile
the player immediately gains 1 victory point.  In the following decline phase after the heyday phase, the player becomes the new starting player.

Bonus Point Tiles
If a player meets the requirements of one of the bonus point tiles, he takes it and places it face down in front of him.  In each decline phase, the player receives 1 victory point for each of these tokens.  If the second tile of a particular kind has been taken, the other players will not receive anything if they meet the conditions later.

Home Towns
The player may use the new actions of hometown in the heyday phase after building the hometown beginning on the next player turn, but only on their own turn and only once each turn!

Name: Superfight: PAX East 2017 Promo Pack
Description: This is a set of nine cards for Superfight that was released at PAX East 2017. Each swag bag contained 1 random card.

Name: Glüx: Extra Chips
Description: Day 8 in the Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017

Name: Guilds of London: Guild of Snowmen
Description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 20

From the Rules:
Gain 1 point while you are master.
No player can use more than one neutral liveryman each against you in any resolution where you have at least one liveryman.

Rules are in English and German.  The title of the tile is only given in English on the tile. The title is the only text on the tile.

Name: Iquazú: Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 Promo
Description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 10.

CONTENTS: 9 bonus tiles

PREPARATION:
Before the game, take out 9 bonus tiles with a light back, replace them with the 9 new bonus tiles, and shuffle.

HOW TO PLAY:
The new bonus tiles are distributed in the interim scoring along with the other bonus tiles.

You can use the new bonus tiles when it is your turn:

For the bonus tile with a gem and an arrow: If you use one of these bonus tiles then you may move on of your gemstones (you have already placed) to the right or left by one column.  The gemstone must be moved within the same row.  You may only move the gemstone if there is an empty space in the rock there (in the neighboring space of the same row). If there are multiple empty spaces in the rock on this space then you may select one of them.

For the bonus tile with the water drop and an X: If you use this bonus tile you may take one water drop off the game board and place it back in the water box.  It doesn't matter whether the water box is currently in front of you or one of the other players.

Due to production reasons, the bonus tiles in the Advent Calendar are slightly thinner than the bonus tiles in the game.

Name: Magic Maze: Roundabout Tile
Description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 1.

Any Hero pawn on the external spaces of this tile can only move clockwise, in the direction of the arrows.  They can leave this tile as usual, through any open pathway or by exploring a new tile.

Name: Mistfall: Winter's Hold
Description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for Day 17

Contents:
1 Location Tile (Winter's Hold)
2 Winter Treasure tiles
1 Rules (in English & German)

The location tile is double sided.  English on one side, German on the reverse.

The Winter's Hold Location Tile can be added to any game of Mistfall or Heart of the Mists.  It provides you with an extra Location which you can decide to visit on your Quest for some greater rewards.

Name: Mysterium: Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 Promo
Description: One of 25 expansions contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017

Name: Nomads: Gift Promo Tiles
Description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for Day 22.

Rules are in English only.
Tiles are language neutral.

Setup

     Shuffle the 6 Gift tiles with the other tiles.


Then form 8 stacks of 14 or 15 random tiles.  Place each stack on one of the 8 square-shaped spaces.

A - Listen to Stories

     If the player takes a Gift tile, he places it in front of himself.


End of Game

     Score one point for each Gift tile you collected.
     Score one additional point for each pair of the same Gift.

Name: Rajas of the Ganges: Mango Village
Description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 6.

The mini expansion contains 8 new province tiles "Mango village" you can build by using two of a kind (color doesn't matter) and the normal building action.
They give small bonuses when being placed like river movement, karma, new dice, upgrade, money. In addition they contain new spots for your workers to score any two of your mango villages again (scaled like the markets for player number).
Finally there is a new brown yield tile for the Navaratnas variant which gives you 3$ for each mango village in your province.
You can't overbuild Mango villages via Master Builder, but you can use Master Builder with the normal 5 and another 5 to build the Mango village over other province tiles.

Rules are in English and German but tiles are language neutral.
Rules in French and Dutch are available online.

Name: Riga: The Grand Masters
Description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 19.

Includes 8 Grand Master Tiles: Riga, Visby, Stockholm, Tallinn, Danzig, Money, Knight, Merchant.
Also includes a rules sheet in English and German

The tiles are double sided and, except for the Money tile, you use a random side in each game.
The two sides are "MAX" and "1".
You also only use a random 4 tiles per game.

Every time you erect a building you check if you can claim one or more Grand Master Tiles.  
The requirements depend on which side of the tile shows.

You can steal MAX tiles if you have more the the required items than the current owner.

Grand Master tiles are scored at the end of the game.  
In general it is 4 points to the owner of the tile and 2 points to the player who has the 2nd most number of required items for that tile.  
Details vary depending on if you are playing with the MAX or the 1 side.  
The Money tile scores a bit differently depending on the number of players.

Name: Schöne Sch#!?e: Stroke of Luck
Description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for Day 13.

Comes with 7 Lucky Pig chips and instructions in German and English.

In addition to their regular chips, give each player a "Lucky Pig" chip (called "pig" for short below) Put all pigs you don't need back in the box.

Instead of a regular chip, once (and only once) during the game, you can use your pig.  If, on your turn, you don't want to take the card that's currently in the center, you can put the pig chip from your supply on the card.

This will have the following effects:

     You're not taking part in the remaining negotiations about this card, meaning that the next time it would be your turn to take the card or pay a chip, you're skipped.  You play along normally once the next card is up.
     When another player takes the card, which by now has one or more pigs on it, they put these pigs in front of themselves next to their face-up cards.  The pigs don't go into the player's supply, so they can't use them again.


Note: If all players place their pigs on the same card, that card and all the pigs are removed from the game.  Turn over the next card.  The last player who put a pig on the previous card goes first on the next one.

Each pig is worth a plus point at the end, regardless of whether you've received another player's pig together with a card or haven't used your own pig and still have it in your supply.

Name: Snowdonia: The North Pole & The Great Bridge Scrapyard Promo Tile
Description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 21.

From the rules:

North Pole
When your surveyor moves on to this tile put a scoring marker on an available space: you will gain 28 points at the end of the game.  Additionally, you may move your Surveyor to any available action space and take that action immediately. Return your surveyor to Llanberis; you may move your Surveyor up the mountain again.

Scrapyard side
Take a build action and discard your train to place a score marker on a spare space: counts as 1 track for game-end scoring OR immediately take 2 steel OR gain 8 points at game end.

Name: Splendor: Guillaume Budé Promo Noble
Description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for Day 12.

Did not include rules.  Instead it had promotional information for the Cities of Splendor expansion.

It is a noble that requires 4 blue and 4 red to claim for 3 points.

Works like any other noble and is just mixed into any game of Splendor that includes nobles. Cannot be used with the "Cities of Splendor" module from the Cities of Splendor expansion.

Another version was available during the Game Boy Geek 2017 Kickstarter campaign that was the same as the one from the Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 aside from different artwork. The Game Boy Geek promo was later available again during the 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Name: The Castles of Burgundy: 9th Expansion – The Team Game
Description: One of 25 expansions contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017

Name: The King's Will: Magyar Expansion
Description: 18 of the 25 expansions contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017

Name: The Lost Expedition: The Creature – Competitive Promo
Description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 14.

Cards recommended for play with the competitive rules, but can be used with any version of the game.

Contains cards: 5.5 (Lair!), 25.5 (Muiraquitã!), 30.5 (Mapinguari!)

Also includes a 4th card with the simple rules for the expansion in English only.

The sheet of paper that comes with each Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 promo contains advertising for the base game, The Lost Expedition.

Name: Tanks: Tiger Tank Expansion
Description:
Heavily armoured and mounting the massive 8.8cm gun the Tiger was something to be feared as no Allied tank could stand in its way. The appearance of the Tiger forced the Allies to return to the drawing boards and find new solutions to counter this heavy hitter.

This pack contains:
1x unassembled Tiger tank
1x Tiger tank card
2x Hero card
1x Crew card
2x Upgrade cards

Name: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: Contract Poison Promo Card
Description: Promo Card received at GenCon 50 for those who purchased Apocrypha Adventure Card Game.  The promo card is titled Contract Poison (1007 Promo) and it has 27 different versions / actions based on signatures obtained on the card.  Each "version" and associated action can be used only if the corresponding creative's signature is on your copy of the card. This promo card uses the cost “Contract,” which means that you may slot it and use its “while contracted” power, but must sacrifice it from your halo at the end of the mission.  Based on the signature(s) received, the appropriate action can be taken.

Name: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: The Saint One Promo Card
Description:
Promo saint card for the Apocrypha Adventure Card Game sent to Kickstarter backers.  Also available when purchasing the base game through the Penny Arcade web store and at conventions.

the saint One
Vaporwearer
Body:3, Mind:4, Rage:1, Soul:2
Powers:
Avoid: Avoid.
Assemble using Rage - Discard 1 Rage or Body gift: Use Mind instead.

Skills: Conjure 1, Resist 1, Sense 2

Card # 1001

Name: Camel Up: The Referee Camel & Istanbul – Caravan Leader Mini Expansion
Description: This mini expansion includes the same black camel and rules provided in Camel Up: The Referee Camel mini expansion and Istanbul: Caravan Leader Mini Expansion into one offering with the rules printed front to back on one sheet.

Name: Superfight: Dungeon Mode
Description:
Welcome to a brand new type of Superfight Expansion! Work as a team to argue your way through the most deadly series of traps and pitfalls you and your friends can imagine, but remember... only one hero can make it out alive!

NOTE: This is only an expansion to Superfight and requires the Superfight Core Deck to play.

Name: Flamme Rouge: Le Grand Baroud (Team Direct Énergie)
Description: Promotional card offered by Gigamic. New stage card.

Name: Codenames: Cartes promo – Personnalités
Description:
This is a promo pack of ten additional double-sided cards for Codenames.

Michael Jackson / Laure Manaudou
Zinédine Zidane / Barack Obama
Albert Einstein / Angelina Jolie
Cléopâtre / Michael Jordan
Céline Dion / Chuck Norris
Léonard de Vinci / Édith Piaf
Jacques Chirac / Marie Curie
Steven Spielberg / Nelson Mandela
Jeanne d'Arc / Jamel Debbouze
Shakespeare / Lady Gaga

Name: Arena: For the Gods! – Henry Peddler's Protectus
Description: Promotional card included with issue #98 of the Plato magazine.

Name: Konito ? TV
Description:
The TV edition of Konito?. Complete the fill-in-the-blank statements on the game cards in order to move forward on the modular scoring board. (The length of the game is determined by how many sections are used to create the board.) There is a time limit to complete each card.

The object is to be the first to complete famous TV catchwords or try to make your teammates find the right answer by any possible means.

This micro edition can be added to the base game or be played as a standalone with special included rules.

Name: Konito ? 2
Description:
Konito? 2 can be played individually or in teams, the idea being to complete the fill-in-the-blank statements on the game cards as fast as possible. 
Song, sport, literature, everyday ... find in team the end of the most famous phrases and phrases extracted from all domains.

This game can be used to renew the basic game Konito or without a board using only cards, hourglass and a new rule.

Name: Artificial Intelligence
Description:
The year is 2090, and the world has witnessed the biggest — the last? — event in human history. Knowledge is the fuel that powers the engine of the new revolution.

Technological Singularity changed everything. Human labor became obsolete; automation and machine learning are the new reality. Machines, run by a flawless artificial intelligence, control production and research, self replicating the answers to problems civilization did not know existed. While prophets whisper the end of time throughout the streets, corporations thrive, pushing boundaries and ignoring old rules. The rush to control the new A.I. era has begun and there’s no time for ethics. Is there time shut down the A.I. Box. Was there ever one?

Artificial Intelligence is an action selection game in which each player plays the role of a big investor pulling the strings from various corporations in order to make money and increase the power of both investor and corp.

Name: Magic Triland
Description:
Description from the rulebook:
Magic Triland is a small, forgotten island in the ocean. The island emerged when a volcano erupted a long time ago. The lava cooled to form a terraced landscape and with time the island became inhabited by people. Kingdoms emerged in the three corners of the island, all there to extract noble metals from the lava.
Today, the kingdoms are ruled by the Queens of Copper and Gold and the King of Silver. Alchemists have settled on the misty shores. Alchemists have the ability to transmute the gold, silver and copper into magic pearls. The kingdoms send out messengers to get magic pearls made by the alchemists and to bring them back to the kingdom. All the messengers wear rings made from the noble metals. They’re on the move day and night, exchanging the rings among themselves as alchemists require two different metals in order to make a magic pearl. It is therefore customary on Magic Triland to carry out trades by bartering at every encounter. A kingdom possessing magic pearls, possesses the highest wisdom and magical power.

User summary:
The game is played on a board with hexagonal blocks of different heights, that form a different board every time. Each player has to pawns with rings (metals), that come in each players color. He moves his pieces using cards covering the height difference between the blocks. Exchanging rings between players when playing pieces meet, enable a player to collect pearls along the side of the board. First player to bring home a pearl of the color opposite to his starting hexagon wins the game

Name: Unearth: Promo Card Set
Description:
4 card Promo Set acquired from preordering Unearth through Brotherwise Games.

Includes Destiny Of The Delvers, Shrouded Path, The Obelisk, and The Sunken Cathedral.

Name: Champions of Midgard: Jalev the Adaptable Promo
Description:
A promo item originally offered through Dice Tower's Season 13 Indiegogo campaign.

A new Champions of Midgard viking leader board.  Jalev is modeled after The Dice Tower contributor, Jason Levine.

Ability:
Gain 1 glory each time you receive blame.

Leader Power:
Clone the Ability of another Leader in play.  That player gains 1 Glory.

Name: Adventures in Zombiewood
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Adventures in Zombiewood is a card and dice-based game that pits you and other unfortunate actors against a horde of Z-lebrities. In a world where the undead have overrun mankind, the only form of entertainment we have left is reenacting movies of times gone by.  Now it's your turn to shine as you remake your favorite zombie classics.

Adventures is Zombiewood is a cooperative game where players each command a different actor each turn.  They use the actor to take on the Z-lebrities that spawn during each Scene they are shooting.  They roll dice in an attempt to match the symbols required to defeat the Z-lebrity.  Anytime a player is unable to defeat the Z-lebrity, their actor is zombified and joins the growing horde to be faced in the game's final scene.  Combat must be fast (as you are trying to conserve film reel) so each combat phase is timed, and all players must be finished with their attack rolls before the timer signals the end of the scene.  Team strategy and quick thinking will give you a chance to survive to the end of your movie.  How many stars will your film earn... and will you survive to find out?

Name: Agricola: Artifex Deck
Description: Agricola: Artifex Deck contains 120 occupation and minor improvement cards for use with the revised edition of Agricola.

Name: Small City around the world #1: Asian Cities
Description:
Description from the publisher:

This is the first pack of expansion of Small City that takes place in real cities. It contains 8 Asian Cities with special twists:

     Shanghai
     Beijing
     Seoul
     Dehli
     Bangkok
     OulaanBaator
     Tokyo
     HongKong

Name: Tramways: Grand Station
Description:
Grand Station is the first set of mini expansions for Tramways.

It contains:

     3 new tiles with special abilities:
          Grand Station
          Stock Exchange
          Park
    
     4 new building cards
     1 Station Master


This expansion is released in a cover flap that explains how the Grand Station of Tramways was built.

Name: Tramways: the Heart of Commerce
Description:
This is the second set of mini expansions for Tramways.

It contains:

     2 new modular boards with a new type of land — the rivers
     10 blue discs for a new actions during the action phase
     5 Ticket inspectors


This expansion is released in a blue cover flap.

Name: Topp-Memento
Description:
How to play:

     Put the red pieces over all the holes and move the top image sheet to a new position.
     Lift up two red pieces at a time and try to find similar pictures underneath.
     If you find two similar pictures, keep the red pieces and try again.
     The player who gets the most pieces wins the game.


—user summary

Name: Fingering
Description: In this game you get a card with 5 rings depicted. The rings are initially upside-down on the playing field. Now it's up to you to find your own rings. To do this, spin the arrow and look at the rings on the playing field. Pay attention when it's your opponents turn, so that you'll see where your rings are!

Name: Lilla Jönssonligan
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Steal as many collectible cards (called filmisar) as possible from the cornflakes factory in Wall-Entuna. If you're lucky, you'll manage to get into the factory four times in one turn.

Each collectible card are worth a certain amount of points. In order for the points to be valid, you must get the card to your home base.

When the whistle blows, the player with the most points wins.


            
        
    


Lilla Jönssonligan was created by Brio, and Tonefilm. Released the same year as the movie Lilla Jönssonligan in Sweden in 1996.

Name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Atrocitus
Description: This expansion to the DC Universe Miniature Game introduces Atrocitus to the game. This white metal kit comes ready to assemble and paint.

Name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Crime Syndicate
Description: This expansion to the DC Universe Miniature Game introduces the Crime Syndicate to the game. This white metal kit comes ready to assemble and paint.  Contains 3 figures - Power Ring, Superwoman, and Ultraman.

Name: Multiverse: Owlman
Description: Knight Models continues the Multiverse line with this expansion. The Multiverse line is a series of expansions that expands both the Batman Miniature Game and the DC Universe Miniature game. This expansion includes a Owlman figure and character sheets.

Name: Multiverse: Batman (Rebirth)
Description: Knight Models continues the Multiverse line with this expansion. The Multiverse line is a series of expansions that expands both the Batman Miniature Game and the DC Universe Miniature game. This expansion includes a Batman figure and character sheets.

Name: Multiverse: Johnny Quick
Description: Knight Models continues the Multiverse line with this expansion. The Multiverse line is a series of expansions that expands both the Batman Miniature Game and the DC Universe Miniature game. This expansion includes a Johnny Quick figure and character sheets.

Name: The Arrival: Tribal Traits
Description:
The Arrival: Tribal Traits is a small expansion for The Arrival.

It consists of 7 different permanent special abilities, one of which is chosen by (or randomly assigned to) each player at the beginning of the game.

They include such things as
- not having to pay the 2 points for building an outpost,
- getting extra tactics tiles
- being able to look at your Fomori tiles

.
..

Name: Commander in Chief
Description:
Commander in Chief is a game showing a soldier's rise through the ranks from Private to Commander in Chief.

The game seems to represent the Spanish American War, in fact one portion of the primary Illustration on the game board seems to be an inverse of Fredric Remington's "Grimes Battery", a drawing representing Battery A, 2nd U.S. Artillery. They saw action in Cuba and were involved in the attack on San Juan Hill.

Player count is unknown as is the method of moving players around the track.

There is no clue as to date of publication or publisher.

Name: Die Maus: Unterwegs in Deutschland
Description:
It's holiday season, and the mouse has packed her backpack and wants to explore Germany. Help her plan and travel in Unterwegs in Deutschland!

Plan a route to reach the desired cities. With a little luck, you are the first to reach your goals. There is much to discover on the road: through the tricky questions of the quiz game, you will learn about the different regions of Germany. In the second game on the back, which is based on the memory principle, younger children from the age of 5 learn the federal states and their capital cities. Good travel!

Name: Haikubes
Description:
You roll dice and make haikus based on the theme dice and using the word dice. Then, I guess you grade each other's haikus - praise them or shame them depending on their quality.

Game includes 63 word cubes.

Name: Dead of Winter: Ruckus Burley
Description:
2017 Dead of Winter comic promo.

A promotional card and character included in the special edition first issue of the Dead of Winter comic.

This promo includes a new character called Ruckus Burley, Unemployed. This comprises a standee, character card and relevant Crossroads card.

Part of the Dead of Winter series.

Name: Rommel
Description:
From the Honour web site:

"Rommel is a tabletop game of great battles in the European and Mediterranean theatres of the Second World War. The player takes the role of a general commanding an entire division, or elements of several divisions, or an entire corps or even an army. Units represent companies and battalions. Tens of thousands of men and machines clash for control of miles of territory. Make decisions about the application of air power, engineering, the use of reconnaissance, the commitment of mobile reserves, and many other things.

Rommel can be played with miniature figures and terrain -OR- with “unit cards” on any flat surface. You may in fact use both in the same game, since the cards can act as labels and play-aids for your bases of miniatures. The basic game introduces players to the operational decisions of a second world war general. Two players can complete a game in 2-3 hours.

The full advanced game features:

- Large battles and multi-player games.
- A complete army and battlefield creation system for fictional scenarios, including thirteen army lists for six major powers.
- Guidelines for players who want to create their own historical scenarios from famous battles.
- Detailed rules for things like amphibious and airborne operations, cavalry, minefields, pioneer and special assault units, and much more.

Use Rommel to recreate your favorite historical battles, or use its army-building system to create fictional armies from six major nationalities during all periods of the war. The “Open Architecture” system allows you to modify the game’s points and units to create any other nationalities and armies, or interesting What-Ifs. (For example, what if Fascist Spain had joined the war in 1941? What if the Americans had entered before Pearl Harbor?)

A unique scenario creation system allows players to “bid” for the resources with which to create their armies and then automatically adjusts scenario conditions and choices accordingly. There is no scripted “attacker and defender.” Instead, a player who chose to fight at a disadvantage in points has many advantages in the creation of the scenario."

Name: The "Science-Mad Kids' Club" Treehouse Building Game
Description:
User Summary

A simple two-player children's game inspired by the spirit and exploits of The Mad Scientists' Club book series. The object of the game is to be the first player to build a treehouse.

The players each have their own team of four kids who are members of the Science-Mad Kids' Club. The players assign various actions for their kids to perform, including finding a suitable tree, gathering tools, and constructing various parts of the treehouse. The kids can be assigned to work alone, or in teams of two to four. The more kids assigned to a task, the greater the chance of success. There is no direct player interaction, just a competition to finish the task first.

The Treehouse Building Game was originally designed in 2003, in conjunction with a re-reading of the Mad Scientists' Club stories, and was first released as a print-and-play design in 2017.

Name: Emergence Dark Ops
Description:
Description from the publisher:

In Emergence Dark Dark Ops, players compete in a Battle Royale: free-for-all format against one another. Players are tasked to retrieve data to their home base to either upgrade abilities for future use or immediately score points and win. Each player is given a secret "target player." Limit your target to the least amount of points, and score massive bonus points, enough to carry you to victory. But be aware that other players will be attempting to sabotage you as well. You won't win Emergence by keeping to yourself. Form soft alliances and timing your betrayal will allow you to gain an advantage, and control the board.

Name: The Game of Life: Yo-kai Watch Edition
Description: Introducing The Game of Life: Yo-kai Watch edition game in which players choose to play as Nate, Katie, Bear, or Eddie, and then set off on exciting adventures! Players explore the city and discover Yo-kai in all different places -- on the beach, at the school, the forest, and at the park. The game spinner might send a player in an unexpected direction, but they can also use their Watch Detection Power cards to capture more Yo-kai! The first player to return home with 3 Yo-kai game medals wins! The game features 2 exclusive Yo-kai Medals (not part of the gameplay.) For 2 to 4 players.

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Maggie Booster
Description: Booster for the Walking Dead: All Out War core set. Includes three miniatures - Maggie, Arnold, and another Walker to add to the herd. Included are character cards and extra equipment cards.
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Glenn Booster
Description: Booster for The Walking Dead: All Out War. Includes three miniatures - Glenn, Lacey, and a Walker to add to the herd. The pack also includes character cards and equipment cards.
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Negan Booster
Description: Booster for The Walking Dead: All Out War. Includes three miniatures - Negan, Andy, and a Walker to add to the herd. Also includes character cards and new equipment cards, including Lucille.
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: Redneck Madness
Description:
In Redneck Madness, two teams are faced by the dominance of the drink that is consumed in the USA. On the one hand, there is the Mega-corporation Puke Cola, which with all its economic power and Human Resources is implanting a new drink very sugary that is becoming addictive to the population. This Mega-corporation will be controlled by a single Player who with his fleet of Delivery trucks must distribute the Puke Cola throughout the States of the USA, hire Employees for his company and form a Puke Cola dispatcher army, manufacture the different varieties of Puke Cola, reinforce its Headquarters with traps to avoid fortuitous incursions and, finally, to avoid that the side of the Redneck steal to them the secret recipe of the Puke Cola.

Against him is the team of the family of Rednecks, the Hickey. They were on vacation in Hawaii when the Puke Cola began to be commercialized. In this team of 1 to 3 players will have to cooperate and help each other. To be able to get Hawaiian Air Tickets to bring back all family members, knock down Puke Cola advertising banners and put up Beer Posters, bribe Puke Cola workers to reveal company secret information, or get drunk to the employees and leave them out of the game. All this while getting better objects and new members of the Hickey family to infiltrate the Puke Cola Factory. Since there will be epic clashes to see who sticks more drinking and who ends up collapsing first, if the members of Puke Cola for the excess of alcohol from the beer. Or the Rednecks for blood sugar overdose.

Once they face the length and breadth of the US, everything will be decided at Puke Cola Headquarters where both teams will face for control of the drink. Will the Rednecks steal the Puke Cola recipe or will Puke Cola's loyal employees get the Redneck out of action for blood sugar overdose?

The game is developed over 10 rounds on a map of the USA in which as the rounds progress the player who manages the corporation of Puke Cola will incorporate in each turn a new delivery truck with which to move and conquer states and put the difficult things to the Rednecks locking up and making difficult the movement, as it conquer states it manages to recruit more distributors for its army that they incorporate to its factory to generate more Puke Cola that gives to him more force of attack for the battle final. Redneck will have to do different missions that will pick up from the deck of missions at the beginning of each turn and for which they will spend cards  of resources to move that will be obtained at the beginning of each turn and when completing missions in the form of rewards. Each mission that can complete an ally involves traveling to one of the 48 US states having to travel on a map of the US with more and more presence of Puke Cola trucks. Among the different types of missions we will have to recruit new Redneck, pay bribes with the money obtained from completing previous missions, combats the deliverymen to reduce their army, release states under Puke Cola control and thus reduce the power of the corporation. The enemy moves all of their trucks to an adjacent state on each turn while allies have to make use of the resources and rewards in the form of cards that they get as the game progresses. After the 10 turns on the map of the USA in which Puke Cola will have increased its army and attack power and the Redneck will see their resistance to the reduced Puke Cola will take place a direct confrontation in the factory of Puke Cola in the pure style Dungeon Crawler with simplified mechanics and fast combat between all the characters at once in each room. The fighting is resolved with a bidding system in which each side bets on all the plates that it picks from its bag which assigns to attack and defense and are compared with the bet by the opposing side, these bids can be modified by the different reward cards obtained in the previous phase.
